text: Irene Moillen is a Swiss para-alpine skier. She represented Switzerland in alpine skiing at the 1976 Winter Paralympics. She also represented Switzerland at the 1980 Winter Paralympics. She won three gold medals at the 1976 Winter Paralympics. == Achievements == {| class="wikitable" width=65% style="font- size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !Year !!Competition !!Location !!Position !!Event !!Time |- | rowspan=3 | 1976 | rowspan=3 | 1976 Winter Paralympics | rowspan=3 | Örnsköldsvik, Sweden | bgcolor=gold | 1st | Alpine Combination II | 0:00.00 |- | bgcolor=gold | 1st | Giant Slalom II | 1:55.51 |- | bgcolor=gold | 1st | Slalom II | 1:55.98 |} == See also == * List of Paralympic medalists in alpine skiing == References == Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Paralympic alpine skiers of Switzerland Category:Alpine skiers at the 1976 Winter Paralympics Category:Alpine skiers at the 1980 Winter Paralympics Category:Medalists at the 1976 Winter Paralympics Category:Paralympic gold medalists for Switzerland Category:Paralympic medalists in alpine skiing
title: Irene Moillen
